You are encouraged to copy, reproduce, adapt, alter, or otherwise make use of this translation in any way you wish. Attribution is appreciated but not legally required.

segments.pli: Aṅguttara Nikāya 4
segments.en: Numbered Discourses 4

segments.pli: 17. Paṭipadāvagga
segments.en: 17. Practice

segments.pli: 170. Yuganaddhasutta
segments.en: 170. In Conjunction

segments.pli: Evaṃ me sutaṃ—
segments.en: So I have heard.

segments.pli: ekaṃ samayaṃ āyasmā ānando kosambiyaṃ viharati ghositārāme.
segments.en: At one time Venerable Ānanda was staying near Kosambi, in Ghosita’s Monastery.

segments.pli: Tatra kho āyasmā ānando bhikkhū āmantesi:
segments.en: There Ānanda addressed the mendicants:

segments.pli: “āvuso bhikkhave”ti.
segments.en: “Reverends, mendicants!”

segments.pli: “Āvuso”ti kho te bhikkhū āyasmato ānandassa paccassosuṃ.
segments.en: “Reverend,” they replied.

segments.pli: Āyasmā ānando etadavoca:
segments.en: Ānanda said this:

segments.pli: “Yo hi koci, āvuso, bhikkhu vā bhikkhunī vā mama santike arahattappattiṃ byākaroti, sabbo so catūhi maggehi, etesaṃ vā aññatarena.
segments.en: “Reverends, all of the monks and nuns who declare in my presence that they have attained perfection, did so by one or other of four paths.

segments.pli: Katamehi catūhi?
segments.en: What four?

segments.pli: Idha, āvuso, bhikkhu samathapubbaṅgamaṃ vipassanaṃ bhāveti.
segments.en: Take a mendicant who develops serenity before discernment.

segments.pli: Tassa samathapubbaṅgamaṃ vipassanaṃ bhāvayato maggo sañjāyati.
segments.en: As they do so, the path is born in them.

segments.pli: So taṃ maggaṃ āsevati bhāveti bahulīkaroti.
segments.en: They cultivate, develop, and make much of it.

segments.pli: Tassa taṃ maggaṃ āsevato bhāvayato bahulīkaroto saṃyojanāni pahīyanti, anusayā byantīhonti.
segments.en: By doing so, they give up the fetters and eliminate the underlying tendencies.

segments.pli: Puna caparaṃ, āvuso, bhikkhu vipassanāpubbaṅgamaṃ samathaṃ bhāveti.
segments.en: Another mendicant develops discernment before serenity.

segments.pli: Tassa vipassanāpubbaṅgamaṃ samathaṃ bhāvayato maggo sañjāyati.
segments.en: As they do so, the path is born in them.

segments.pli: So taṃ maggaṃ āsevati bhāveti bahulīkaroti.
segments.en: They cultivate, develop, and make much of it.

segments.pli: Tassa taṃ maggaṃ āsevato bhāvayato bahulīkaroto saṃyojanāni pahīyanti, anusayā byantīhonti.
segments.en: By doing so, they give up the fetters and eliminate the underlying tendencies.

segments.pli: Puna caparaṃ, āvuso, bhikkhu samathavipassanaṃ yuganaddhaṃ bhāveti.
segments.en: Another mendicant develops serenity and discernment in conjunction.

segments.pli: Tassa samathavipassanaṃ yuganaddhaṃ bhāvayato maggo sañjāyati.
segments.en: As they do so, the path is born in them.

segments.pli: So taṃ maggaṃ āsevati bhāveti bahulīkaroti.
segments.en: They cultivate, develop, and make much of it.

segments.pli: Tassa taṃ maggaṃ āsevato bhāvayato bahulīkaroto saṃyojanāni pahīyanti, anusayā byantīhonti.
segments.en: By doing so, they give up the fetters and eliminate the underlying tendencies.

segments.pli: Puna caparaṃ, āvuso, bhikkhuno dhammuddhaccaviggahitaṃ mānasaṃ hoti.
segments.en: Another mendicant’s mind is seized by restlessness to realize the teaching.

segments.pli: Hoti so, āvuso, samayo yaṃ taṃ cittaṃ ajjhattameva santiṭṭhati sannisīdati ekodi hoti samādhiyati.
segments.en: But there comes a time when their mind is stilled internally; it settles, unifies, and becomes immersed in samādhi.

segments.pli: Tassa maggo sañjāyati.
segments.en: The path is born in them.

segments.pli: So taṃ maggaṃ āsevati bhāveti bahulīkaroti.
segments.en: They cultivate, develop, and make much of it.

segments.pli: Tassa taṃ maggaṃ āsevato bhāvayato bahulīkaroto saṃyojanāni pahīyanti, anusayā byantīhonti.
segments.en: By doing so, they give up the fetters and eliminate the underlying tendencies.

segments.pli: Yo hi koci, āvuso, bhikkhu vā bhikkhunī vā mama santike arahattappattiṃ byākaroti, sabbo so imehi catūhi maggehi, etesaṃ vā aññatarenā”ti.
segments.en: All of the monks and nuns who declare in my presence that they have attained perfection, did so by one or other of these four paths.”

segments.pli: Dasamaṃ.
Paṭipadāvaggo dutiyo.
Saṅkhittaṃ vitthārāsubhaṃ,
Dve khamā ubhayena ca;
Moggallāno sāriputto,
Sasaṅkhāraṃ yuganaddhena cāti.

suttaplex.blurb: Ways of practicing serenity and discernment.
